name: Drivers Questionnaire
description: The Drivers Questionnaire explores unconscious internal pressures that shape behavior, such as tendencies toward speed, perfectionism, or emotional restraint. Participants rate five descriptions based on personal applicability, assigning a high mark to the most accurate and a low mark to the least accurate. This assessment helps reveal individual tendencies and internal processes influencing behavior.

options.text: Endurance is a valuable asset
I like to see people doing their best to get things right
Considering all the effort I put into things I should get more done
I find myself doing too many things at the last minute
On balance I adapt more to other peoples wishes than they do to mine
Casualness and carelessness bother me
It's keeping on doing things that interests me more than finishing with them
When people are slow about saying something I want to interrupt or finish the sentence
I have a fair amount of imagination when it comes to guessing what people need
When someone gets emotional my reaction is often to make a joke of it or else be critical
I don't mind things being hard. I can always find the energy
I prefer to use just the minimum necessary time to get to a place
If someone doesn't like me I either try hard to get them to like me or I walk away
It is rare for me to feel hurt
If it's a question of doing something properly I'd rather do it myself
I get impatient with slow people
Normally I prefer to take people's wishes into account before deciding something
I show a calm face even when my feelings are running high
I don't make excuses for poor work
There's something about coming to the end of a job I don't like
I put a lot of effort into things
Sometimes it is better to just do something and leave the discussion until later
I'm cautious about asking favours
I don't let people look after me much
I sometimes find it hard to stop myself correcting people
Sometimes I talk too quickly
I'm uncomfortable when people are upset or displeased with me
I dislike people making a fuss about things
Things can always be improved on
I don't believe in the 'easy way'
I think I do a lot to be considerate towards others
I usually manage to cope even when I feel I've had more than enough
I prefer doing things really well even if it takes longer
I tend to start things and then gradually lose energy or interest
I want to get a whole lot of things finished, then I run out of time
I'm not what you would call soft
I prefer to do things right first time, than have to re-do them
I sometimes repeat myself because I'm not sure I've been understood
My energy is often at its highest when I have a lot of things to do
It's quite hard to say no when someone really wants something
I like to use words correctly
I like exploring a variety of alternatives before getting started
It's quite like me to be already thinking of the next thing before I have finished the first
When I'm sure someone likes me I am more at ease
I can put up with a great deal without anyone realising it
People who just want to finish something tend to irritate me
I prefer to just plunge into something rather than have to plan
If a person doesn't know what I want I'd rather not have to ask directly
Other people start whining and complaining before I do
I prefer to correct myself rather than have other people correct me
If I had 20% more time I could relax more
I often smile and nod when people talk to me
When people get excited I can stay very cool and rational
I can do something well and still be critical of myself
There are so many things to take into account it can be hard to get to the end of something
I have a good intuitive sense if someone likes me or not
I think duty and reason pay off better than emotion in the long run
I tend to see quickly how something could be improved on
Some people have a habit of over simplifying things
Sometimes the more there is to do, the more I get done

changePoints: Deliver on time regardless of detail

advice.basis: The basis of BE PERFECT is that every task, person, product or even statement can and should be rated as more or less good or bad.
advice.predictedBehaviour: BE PERFECT will probably worry about getting something wrong, want to work out every last detail before offering it for comment, insist on getting it exactly right when a rough approximation would be more useful, want to get things right first time, keep on and on to complete a job long after productive energy has been used up and be well organised.
advice.consequence: All with the consequence of poor time planning (keeps checking when no longer necessary or when people would rather see a draft quickly), checking things themselves rather than trusts others, hating others' criticism (go out of their way to avoid it - is often complicated), being driven to distraction by a HURRY UP.
advice.worksWell: They work well in jobs where detail is important and the set standards are important.
advice.improvement: For improvement they need to realise that less than their best may be what is needed at the early stages, realise that their qualities of accuracy and organisation may have a poor impact on others with different drivers.
advice.managerHelp: Managers need to help them give themselves permission to allow for and forgive mistakes, imperfections and incompleteness.

weaknesses: Do not work well with Be Perfects
changePoints: Being early is not a crime
handling: Encourage them to be on time

advice.basis: The basis of HURRY UP is that there is some additional virtue in doing something in a short time.
advice.predictedBehaviour: HURRY UP will probably rush at things (talk rapidly), interrupt and finish others' sentences (try and do more than time allows), be good in a crisis and do things at the last minute.
advice.consequence: All with the consequence that they are often late and miss deadlines, they leave people behind (literally and metaphorically), they plan time badly ('I can't waste time' so they rush around and don't plan things), they have poor judgement over how long and how much energy jobs require, they are prone to mistakes in terms of, poor quality and inattention to detail (will be driven to despair by a BE PERFECT).
advice.worksWell: They work well when ACTUALLY under time pressure because their energy will be high.
advice.improvement: For improvement they need to think and plan ahead with regard to the REALITY of available time, have short term goals with defined standards (bite sized jobs).
advice.managerHelp: Manager needs to help them give themselves permission to be satisfied with what can be done comfortably within the given time.

advice.basis: The basis of PLEASE PEOPLE is that someone has to find satisfaction in you performing a task, or at least should not be displeased.
advice.predictedBehaviour: PLEASE PEOPLE will probably tend to be apologetic, to give way relatively easily (to agree), to try and avoid conflict, worry about upsetting other people and not begin unless someone will notice them working.
advice.consequence: All with the consequence that they will probably be a good team member but not a team leader, go out of their way to make sure that you are happy (not always with the desired effect), find confronting poor performance very difficult (be moody and easily depressed), give credit when credit is not due, expect people to know what they want without telling them (clairvoyance) and appear compromising.
advice.worksWell: They can be the mortar that holds a team together and perform the 'maintenance' functions of involving people, checking, summarising etc. They will be sympathetic, empathetic, tolerant and flexible.
advice.improvement: For improvement they need to get on with things. Let actions speak for themselves and turn sympathy outwards not inwards.
advice.managerHelp: Manager needs to help them give themselves permission to work out what they want for themselves say what they believe and to think independently.

effectiveness: Corner stone in a crisis good

advice.basis: The basis of BE STRONG is that something is particularly worth doing if it costs a lot. Not so much in effort but stress, worry and near disaster.
advice.predictedBehaviour: BE STRONG will probably put a lot of pressure on themselves, have the feeling that they are on the verge of cracking up or not being able to cope any more, often speak in a strong voice, shoulder responsibility and additional burdens well, be super cool under pressure, not ask for help (must cope on my own...).
advice.consequence: All with the consequence of being very difficult to notice externally (this difficulty is often a good sign of a BE STRONG), showing little outward emotion, appearing to have very 'broad shoulders' (gritty/laconic or jovial people) and can sap the energy of others.
advice.worksWell: They are very good at accommodating poor conditions or putting up with things that many would find unreasonable.
advice.improvement: For improvement they need to learn to relax and admit to being weak in some situations.
advice.managerHelp: Manager needs to help them give themselves permission to take things easy sometimes and accept their emotions (fear, sadness, joy).

weaknesses: Effort for the sake of it

advice.basis: The basis of TRY HARD is that it is always worth putting more, and more, and even more effort into doing something.
advice.predictedBehaviour: TRY HARD will probably puff and blow a lot, have 5 projects going simultaneously, when talking go on and on and on..., make things harder than they are, spread out a task and be good at hanging in there and making a last effort.
advice.consequence: All with the consequence that they will digress from the key task (dislike finishing), start things and then lose interest and energy (may not follow through on projects), they can sap the energy of others.
advice.worksWell: They are very good in start up situations and where effort and energy to complete are needed.
advice.improvement: For improvement they need to finish some things, put some full stops into their sentences and follow through when necessary.
advice.managerHelp: Manager needs to help them give themselves permission to let things go and be satisfied with little endings.
